sense.name: the act of expressing approval, support of something
sense.examples: The trade union has given its endorsement to the Democratic candidate. John was pleased with our endorsement of his suggestion to meet at a pub after work. The review is a real endorsement of the film. Mary went ahead with the project without securing any endorsement from her boss.

sense.name: a paid product recommendation
sense.examples: The basketball star made millions of dollars from endorsements of athletic shoes. The celebrity ended her endorsement of the cosmetic line.

sense.name: a validating signature on a check
sense.examples: Your endorsement is required before the bank can deposit this check. The endorsement appeared to be a forgery according to the handwriting expert.

sense.name: clause on insurance policy that specifies provisions that can modify the policy
sense.examples: Endorsements can also be added to your home owner insurance policy. This endorsement will allow your insurance company to automatically change your policy limit during the policy period.
